page.title: 03CHANDLER'S FORD LIBRARY
page.content: This public library was opened in 1983.It differs from a library built ten years ago as it is a{horseshoe {shape}instead of rectangular. Inside it is light and airy. The paint work is red. A spiral staircase leads from the ground floor to the second storey which is like an open balcony, extending over half the ground floor area. The library is carpeted throughout. The innerside of the horseshoe is all glass and the windows are in an arch shape. There are display boards on the ground floor where societies and clubs may advertise events. The{library opens}at 10 00 daily and closes at 19 00 except for Mondays when it shuts at 17 00 and Wednesdays and Sundays when it is closed all day. {Librarians} are on duty whenever the library is open, and also all day
